laboratory_examinations.findings: Blood glucose decreased to 2.3 mmol/liter after 12 h of fasting at 21 months of age. Hypoglycemia was present at 2.2 mmol/liter after a 15-h fast at 5.5 years of age.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The blood glucose values were 2.3 mmol/liter at 21 months and 2.2 mmol/liter at 5.5 years, illustrating persistent hypoglycemia.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Pronounced ketonuria was observed during both the 12-h fasting tolerance test and the 15-h fast.

At 6 years old, the /H9252-hydroxybutyrate level was 1.7 mmol/liter in the KH twin and 0.1 mmol/liter in the healthy twin after 12 h of fasting. During an infusion test, it peaked at 16.6 mmol/liter in the KH twin initially and later at 5.0 mmol/liter in a follow-up test 7 months later.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The maximum increase in /H9252-hydroxybutyrate levels decreased from 16.6 mmol/liter during the initial test to 5.0 mmol/liter during the follow-up test.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal glucose production rates, observed at 21.7 and 23.3 /H9262mol/kg body weight per minute in the KH and healthy twin, respectively.
Rates were similar, 6.8 and 5.8 /H9262mol/kg body weight per minute in the KH and healthy twin, respectively.
